channel.title: Changing your ip
channel.description:
hi i was trying to change my ip but under cmd i type in ipconfig and it says 'ipconfig' is not reconised as an internal or external command
and i was changing the enviroment variables a few days ago maybe that has something to do with hit :confused:
thanks
-saml[br][size=1]Posted at: May 16, 2006, 11:21:59 am[/size][hr]could someone post a screenshot of their enviroment variables please because i think that that may be the problem because you get that 'javac' is not reconised error aswell when you do not have the enviroment variables set up properly

item.title: Changing your ip
item.dc:creator: @omg_omg_omg omg omg omg
item.description:
@omg_omg_omg wrote:

I think you just put it after the pre-existing variable, like this: (original varible);%SystemRoot%\system32;%SystemRoot%;%SystemRoot%\System32\Wbem;[br][size=1]Posted on: May 30, 2007, 08:54:42 AM[/size][hr]THANK YOU SO MUCH, BOBDOLE81!!! IT WORKS!!!

Read full topic

item.title: Changing your ip
item.dc:creator: @sk84lifesam sk84lifesam
item.description:
@sk84lifesam wrote:

which one do i put that under though?[br][size=1]Posted at: May 17, 2006, 11:02:17 am[/size][hr][quote=“BobDole81, post:2, topic:2969”]Did you replace the existing contents of the system variables? If so, add this after the current variable value:

;%SystemRoot%system32;%SystemRoot%;%SystemRoot%System32Wbem; [/quote]

what path name do i put it after though?

Read full topic

item.title: Changing your ip
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Did you replace the existing contents of the system variables? If so, add this after the current variable value:

;%SystemRoot%\system32;%SystemRoot%;%SystemRoot%\System32\Wbem;

Read full topic

thanks
